direction.raw_text: Well, you can't think of everything. (PAUSE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. (PAUSE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew it was over...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (TO BELLA) ...it's in the back. BELLA WALKS TO THE BACK OF THE TARP, RAISES A CORNER, LOOKS IN. HE LOOKS AT HIS HANDS, AND TAKES OUT A HANDKERCHIEF, AND WIPES OFF THE BLACK PAINT. HE LOWERS THE TARP DOWN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why dun' he shoot me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cause it's over. It's all done.    That's the deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He ain't gonna shoot me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he hadn't aughta point a gun at me. (PAUSE) It's insincere... MOORE SITS DOWN ON AN UNOPENED WOODEN BOX, IN THE DOORWAY OF THE GARAGE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God, I'm tired...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, no.   You told me, "you knew him before."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. I did. (TO BELLA) (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in and drive (TO MOORE) I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said that. (PAUSE) Well. (PAUSE) You must be under quite a lot of stress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a pretty plan, though, wunnit...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cute as a Chinese baby...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for everything. (FRAN GETS UP INTO THE TRUCK)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll be alright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You always are. (PAUSE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I missed this trick, though, didn't I...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...the best laid plans of mice and men...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said Nobody's Perfect. (PAUSE) You take care. (TO BELLA) Alright, let's go. THE TRUCK DRIVES OFF. ANGLE ON MOORE, AS HE SLOWLY SHAKES HIS HEAD.   HE SIGHS.   HE WALKS BACK INTO THE SHED.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: BERGMAN TRIES NOW ONE AND NOW ANOTHER OF THE RAILINGS
THE KNIFE CANNOT RAISE SHAVINGS ON ANY OF THEM
BERGMAN, AS HE LOOKS BACK AT THE SHORE
GETS OFF THE BOAT, AND ADVANCES ON MOORE, WHO IS STANDING ON THE PIER
GESTURES TO THE THUGS, WHO TAKE HOLD OF MOORE'S ARMS
LOOKS AROUND WILDLY AT THE DESERTED PIER
BERGMAN ADVANCES ON MOORE, HOLDING THE KNIFE
BERGMAN NEARS MOORE, MOORE TURNS, BREAKING THE HOLD OF THE TWO MEN
HE HITS ONE IN THE THROAT, KICKS AT THE OTHER, AND STARTS TO RUN

ONE OF THE THUGS PULLS A PISTOL, AND SHOOTS AT MOORE, AND MOORE FALLS TO THE PIER, GRASPING HIS SHOULDER, HE GETS SLOWLY UP, AND FACES BERGMAN, AND THE THUGS, WHO STAND ON THE PIER ALONGSIDE THE SAILBOAT

result.ToD: A HENCHMAN PUTS A PISTOL INTO IT
result.heading: A HENCHMAN PUTS A PISTOL INTO IT
HE SPEAKS, MOORE KEEPS TURNING, SO THAT THE SUN IS BEHIND MOORE, AND SHINING INTO THE EYES OF BERGMAN AND HIS ACCOMPLICES, WHO NOW STAND WITH THEIR BACKS TO THE BOAT
BEHIND HIM WE SEE BLANE EMERGE FROM THE SAILLOCKER ON THE BOAT'S DECK, BLANE HOLDS A SHOTGUN
HE SHOOTS BERGMAN AND THE TWO THUGS, ONE OF THE THUGS TURNS AND FIRES AT BLANE, WHO IS WOUNDED
BLANE FIRES AGAIN AT THE THUG, AND STUMBLES ON TO THE PIER, AND FALLS BACKWARD INTO THE WATER BETWEEN THE BOAT AND THE PIER
MOORE, WHO MOVES JERKILY, TO THE SIDE OF THE PIER
HE TRIES TO PUSH THE BOAT AWAY, TO GET TO BLANE IN THE WATER
HE UNTIES THE LINE WHICH HOLDS THE BOAT TO THE PIER, AND PUSHES THE BOAT AWAY
HE THROWS THE LINE TO BLANE, WHO USES IT TO LIFT HIMSELF UP ONTO THE PIER
TWO MEN SIT FOR A MOMENT, CATCHING THEIR BREATH
HE STANDS, AND HELPS BLANE TO HIS FEET
THEY LOOK AROUND, BEHIND THEM, THE SAILBOAT IS DRIFTING OUT TO SEA
STEPPING OVER ONE OF THE BODIES OF THE THUGS
KICKS HIS BODY OVER THE SIDE OF THE PIER, INTO THE WATER
WALKS OVER HIS BODY, AND HE AND BLANE CONTINUE DOWN THE PIER
FROM BLANE, AND STEPS BACK TO BERGMAN
BACK TO BLANE, AND THE TWO HEAD OFF, HELPING EACH OTHER DOWN THE PIER
LOOKS UP, BLANE, WALKING WITH A CANE, SLIDES INTO THE BOOTH OPPOSITE HIM
BOTH SIT, LOOKING OUT THE WINDOW
WAITRESS COMES BY WITH A COFFEEPOT
EXT THE DINER, AS THE TWO WALK ACROSS AN INDUSTRIAL AREA
THEY CONTINUE WALKING ACROSS THE STREET TO REVEAL THEY ARE IN THE INDUSTRIAL AREA OUTSIDE THE BOXING GYM
THERE ARE MANY KIDS PLAYING IN THE STREET
TAKES OUT A SLIP OF PAPER, AND HANDS IT TO MOORE
BLANE HANDS HIM THE KEY TO THE GARAGE
WE SEE BLANE WALK ACROSS THE STREET, A CONVERTIBLE PULLS UP, DRIVEN BY A VERY BEAUTIFUL YOUNG WOMAN
BLANE GETS INTO THE PASSENGER SEAT AND MOTIONS HER TO DRIVE
ON BLANE'S CAR, AS IT DRIVES OFF, BLANE TURNS BACK TO LOOK AT MOORE ONE LAST TIME, THEN SHRUGS AND TURNS FORWARD
ON MOORE, AS HE WALKS ACROSS THE STREET, TURNS A CORNER AND STANDS BEFORE A GARAGE DOOR
USES THE KEY AND OPENS A SMALL DOOR SET INTO THE OVERHEAD DOORS OF THE GARAGE
NEWISH TRUCK, WITH A LARGE ENGINE LASHED ONTO ITS BED
THE ENGINE IS PAINTED IN FRESH BLACK PAINT
BEHIND IT, THE OLD BATTERED PICKUP TRUCK, UP ON A JACK, ITS BED FULL OF THE RUSTED PIPES OF THE DISCARDED BOXING EQUIPMENT, AND THE OLD ROTTEN LEATHER "HEAVYBAG
TAKES OUT A PACK OF CIGARETTES AND A LIGHTER, HE IS ABOUT TO LIGHT A CIGARETTE, WHEN HE LOOKS OVER AT THE NEW TRUCK
PUTS THE CIGARETTES DOWN ON THE OLD TRUCK, BENDS DOWN, AND PICKS UP A CAN OF BLACK PAINT
HE WALKS TO THE NEW TRUCK AND APPLIES TOUCHUP PAINT TO THE ENGINE LASHED IN THE BACK
HE NODS AT IT, AND THEN, SATISFIED, HE TAKES A TARP AND COVERS THE ENGINE

result.ToD: GETS INTO THE NEW PICKUP TRUCK AND STARTS IT
result.heading: GETS INTO THE NEW PICKUP TRUCK AND STARTS IT
IT WARMS UP HE GOES TO THE FRONT OF THE GARAGE, WIPING THE BLACK PAINT OFF OF HIS HANDS WITH A RAG
HE RAISES THE SHED DOOR, TO REVEAL FRAN STANDING THERE
SMILES AND KISSES HER AND TAKES HER BACK TOWARD THE NEW PICKUP TRUCK
LIFTS THE TARP TO REVEAL THE ENGINE, COATED IN BLACK PAINT, SITTING THERE
TOUCHES THE BRUISE ON HIS HEAD
MOORE, (TOUCHES HIS FOREHEAD, AND THE BRUISE, WINCES)

HE WALKS BACK TOWARD FRAN, WHO IS STANDING AT THE TRUCK
HE MOVES TO MOORE, AND HE FRISKS HIM, AND FINDS NOTHING, AND TAKES A STEP AWAY
ON MOORE, AS HE LOOKS FROM BELLA TO FRAN
WALKS TO THE BACK OF THE TARP, RAISES A CORNER, LOOKS IN

SITS DOWN ON AN UNOPENED WOODEN BOX, IN THE DOORWAY OF THE GARAGE
